text:
(1)
Demolition of the Federal Hall replica, Bryant Park, east-center, the New York Public Library in the background, the year after the George Washington Bicentennial Celebration.
The skyscrapers seen on the roof of the Library are, from left to right: the Chrysler Building, the Lincoln Building, the Lefcourt Colonial Building on Madison Avenue and the much smaller Farmers Loan & Trust Building on Fifth Avenue, and finally the New York Trust Company Building.
April 24, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
Another view of the same.  April 24, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
Another view of the same; the camera points southeast.  April 24, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

title: Manhattan: Bryant Park - East Center

text:
(1)
Bryant Park, northwestern quarter, seen from the rear of the New York Public Library, showing the Park under reconstruction.
April 30, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, a later stage of the reconstruction carried out under
Park Commissioner Robert Moses.
August 8, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same, another view.
August 11, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

title: Manhattan: Bryant Park (Northwestern quarter).

text:
(1)

Bryant Park, S.E. corner, showing the Outdoor-Library located in this corner by the Extension Division of the New York Public Library; named by the W.P.A.

August 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)

A close up of the Librarians table with open racks alongside.  This unit maintains a very informal service and has been highly popular.

August 1935.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Bryant Park (Southeastern corner).

text:
(1)

title: Manhattan: Bryant Park (Southeastern corner).

text:
(1) Bryant Park: A View of the Open-Air Library of the Extension Division of the New York Public Library located in the S.E. corner. This scene shows several readers and a librarian at the periodical rack at the foot of the Goethe bust.

Fall 1936.

Gift of Geo. D. Chinn.

(2) The librarian's table; a centre of this informal and highly popular unit.

Fall 1936.

Gift of Geo. D. Chinn.

title: Manhattan: Bryant Park

text:
Street Scenes: Bryant Park provides the setting for this lovely scene.

Morris Engel

1941
title: Manhattan: Bryant Park - Street Scenes

text:
Street Scenes: Taking a sun bath in Bryant Park, near the Cullen Bryant Monument.

Morris Engel

1941
title: Street scenes - [Sunbathing in Bryant Park, near Cullen Bryant Monument.]
